comments.author: Marina
comments.content: This is an elaborated meal! Well done. I think I'll start with salsa and cilantro dressing.

comments.author: Jenny
comments.content: I've never had sopes, but I've always wanted to try them.  This looks fantastic.  Plantains are one of my favorite foods, and I love that you used them in this.

comments.author: Noelle (@singerinkitchen)
comments.content: Fantastic! I need to try your version. Here are the ones I have made: http://www.singerskitchen.com/2009/09/mexican-sopes-and-watermelon-margaritas.html

comments.author: amee
comments.content: I LOVE sopes!!! so hard to find veggie ones!!

comments.author: Saundra
comments.content:
It's crazy how hungry photos of food can make, especially when it sounds tasty too!

thanks for the post, I'll try this asap!

comments.author: Patty O
comments.content:
OMG - Made these tonight with my Valentine and they were soooo good. The two Salsas were really well balanced and the plaintains were just Yum. Photo here:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/wigfur/6879423019/

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That's awesome, love the heart-shaped sope!

comments.author: Vegan Shake Lover
comments.content: Hi, thanks for sharing this recipe. We'll give it a try. For the filling, can i use cucumber instead of zucchini? Thanks again.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hmm, I think cucumber might be a little odd in this one... but  I know some folks do use cooked cucumber, so if you like that, go for it!

comments.author: Vegan Shake Lover
comments.content: Such a wonderful recipe! What i did was try it with cucumber first since that's what's available on the pantry the moment i saw this. Then the following day i went to the market and got some zucchini. both came out delicious but the zucchini works a lot better, texture and flavor  wise. I must say, your website is worth sharing to others. Have a great day!
